title: Commending Sheila Penn for her many civic contributions as well as her tireless efforts to enhance the lives of persons with disabilities within the Great Neck community
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE  RESOLUTION  commending  Sheila  Penn  for  her  many  civic
contributions as well as her tireless efforts to enhance  the  lives  of
persons with disabilities within the Great Neck community

WHEREAS,  It is the sense of this Legislative Body to recognize that the
quality and character of life in the communities across New  York  State
are  reflective of the concerned and dedicated efforts of those individ-
uals that are devoted to the welfare of the community and its citizenry;
and
  WHEREAS, Sheila Penn has given not only of her time and  energies  but
also of her competence, intelligence and leadership and consequently has
been designated for special honor; and
  WHEREAS, Attendant to such concern, and fully in accord with its long-
standing  traditions,  this  Legislative Body is justly proud to commend
Sheila Penn for her many civic contributions as  well  as  her  tireless
efforts  to enhance the lives of persons with disabilities in her commu-
nity of Great Neck, New York; and
  WHEREAS, Sheila Penn, daughter of a London-born  tailor,  was  briefly
separated  from  her  parents,  while living in London, and relocated to
avoid the imminent German attack during World War II; one year later, in
1940, after moving back to London  with  her  parents  and  sister,  the
Germans  launched  an attack on London for 57 straight days; despite the
daunting and dangerous circumstances Sheila and her family survived; and
  WHEREAS, Years later, Sheila Penn fulfilled her  dream  of  coming  to
America,  leaving  behind  her  homeland  that had been decimated by the
scars of war, and finding immediate employment in her new country; and
  WHEREAS, While in the United  States,  Sheila  Penn  felt  a  call  to
action,  joining  many  committees  in which she worked tirelessly in an
effort to enhance the lives of the citizens within her community; and
  WHEREAS, Sheila Penn eventually married a former Marine who worked  as
court clerk in Manhattan, and became the mother of two boys, one in need
of special education; and
  WHEREAS,  Not  forgetting the effects of her own brief separation from
her  parents,  Sheila  Penn  remained  determined  to  keep  her  family
protected;  the  family  eventually settled in Great Neck, New York from
Brooklyn because of the education the village could offer  her  develop-
mentally disabled son; and
  WHEREAS, Years after moving to Great Neck, Sheila Penn became a found-
ing  member  and  President  of  the  Foundation  of  Community  Unified
Services, Inc. (FOCUS), which began in Great Neck in 1988 by a group  of
parents of children with disabilities; and
  WHEREAS,  Among its many contributions, FOCUS is responsible for open-
ing a residence which would take individuals with  disabilities  in  the
event their parents were no longer able to take care of them; and
  WHEREAS,  While  FOCUS  continues to remain Sheila Penn's passion, she
currently serves on the Great Neck Village Chamber of  Commerce  as  the
only  non-profit board member and on the board of directors of the local
senior center; and
  WHEREAS, Throughout the entire period  of  her  community  service,  a
period  of  constructive  involvement, Sheila Penn has stood constant in
dignity, good grace and humor; and
  WHEREAS, With her throughout have been  her  husband,  and  their  two
sons,  all  of whom feel privileged to be a part of her life and rejoice
in her achievements; and
  WHEREAS, From time to time this Legislative Body takes note of certain
altruistic individuals it wishes to acknowledge for their  philanthropic

contributions  to  our society which enhance the basic humanity among us
all; now, therefore, be it
  RESOLVED,  That  this  Legislative  Body pause in its deliberations to
commend Sheila Penn for her many civic  contributions  as  well  as  her
tireless  efforts  to  enhance the lives of persons with disabilities in
her community of Great Neck, New York; and be it further
  RESOLVED, That a copy of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted to Sheila Penn, Great Neck, New York.
